title: odd serif font with curlicues type ID...?
content:
This seemed so unusual I just had to know what it was!

I suppose it could be an extra-characters version of some 'normal' font, but it's not an italic, I think, so I'd be happy if it could be identified.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Spg36.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130220130128/http:/typophile.com/files/Spg36.png) | 2.7 KB |
author: elfee

comments.content: I think that's [Albemarle](http://web.archive.org/web/20130220130128/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/albemarle/), with the swash T and K. :)
